cancer_subtype: Not specified in provided report (microscopic review needed)
recommended_treatment: Adjuvant radiation therapy with vaginal brachytherapy or pelvic external beam radiation therapy ± vaginal brachytherapy
description: Friable granular endometrial lesion measuring 3.5 × 3.3 × 0.9 cm with >50% myometrial invasion (2.4 cm of 4.7 cm), negative parametria, and 0/17 lymph nodes involved; consistent with FIGO IB (pT1b N0).
patient_notes: The surgical pathology confirms endometrial carcinoma measuring 3.5 × 3.3 × 0.9 cm with deep myometrial invasion but no nodal metastases. To reduce recurrence risk, we recommend adjuvant radiation therapy—either vaginal brachytherapy alone or combined pelvic external beam radiation with a brachytherapy boost. Further pathology details, including grade and LVSI status, will guide final recommendations.

verification.assessment: The extraction captured stage and treatment recommendation correctly but introduced unsupported details (tumor size, subtype, LVSI) and omitted key pathologic elements. Substantial corrections needed before use.

cancer_organ_type.issues: The report specifies 'Endometrial cancer'; the extracted 'Uterine cancer' is too generic. It should be Endometrial (uterine corpus) cancer.

cancer_subtype.issues: The snippet provided does not explicitly state 'endometrioid adenocarcinoma.' Without a microscopic subtype in the text, assignment of subtype is unsupported.

figo_stage.issues: FIGO IB is correct given >50% myometrial invasion (2.4 cm of 4.7 cm thickness).

pathologic_stage.issues: pT1b N0 M0 corresponds to FIGO IB with no nodal metastasis; M0 is assumed.

recommended_treatment.issues: Adjuvant radiation with vaginal brachytherapy ± pelvic EBRT is consistent with NCCN guidance for stage IB high–intermediate/high-risk disease.

description.issues: Tumor dimensions are misstated as 3.5 × 3.3 × 1.6 cm; gross report gives 3.5 × 3.3 × 0.9 cm. LVSI is asserted but not in the provided text. Lymph node count (0/18) may not match the nodes described.

patient_notes.issues: Notes mirror the flawed description (incorrect size, unverified LVSI). They should reflect the accurate measurements and reported findings.
